pr_title: Updated APIs with docs. Fixed few issues

timeline.message: Updated APIs with docs. Fixed few issues

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * This a synchronous client and is used to perform operations in a synchronous way
          
          
            
             * Calls to client API's are blocked for completion.
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@
 
 /**
  * Provides a client-side logical representation of the Azure Cosmos DB service.
- * SyncClient is used to perform operations in a synchronous way
+ * This a synchronous client and is used to perform operations in a synchronous way

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * By default, SESSION consistency level is used if none is provided.
          
          
            
             * By default, account consistency level is used if none is provided.
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -16,12 +16,13 @@ /** * Helper class to build CosmosAsyncClient {@link CosmosAsyncClient} and CosmosClient {@link CosmosClient} * instances as logical representation of the Azure Cosmos database service. - * + *

* When building client, endpoint() and key() are mandatory APIs, without these the initialization will fail. - * + *

* Though consistencyLevel is not mandatory, but we strongly suggest to pay attention to this API when building client. - * By default, database account level consistency level is used if none is provided. - * + * By default, SESSION consistency level is used if none is provided.

replies.bodyText: This will enable us treat it a as bug fix for later, otherwise its always required behavior.
replies.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText: Good point, but is it okay to represent false documentation when we know its a bug at first place ?
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: Changes done. Will treat this as a bug in future.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:
Is it supposed to be non-public?
Its in implementation, guess its okey.
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText: Yes, implementation detail. Its fine if it is public.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:
Wow, that was a bug?
Is PKrangeID always guaranteed in this code path?
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText: this is for validation. Why this change is needed?
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
Yes, this was a bug.
It is guaranteed, if not present, then it is a bug.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: This code path will always throw IllegalStateException - because we are always passing empty string - here is the issue - #9053
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: @kushagraThapar #9053 is for the PartitionKey.None is that right link?
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Yes, my bad. Here is the right link - #10493
replies.author: kushagraThapar
moderakh
kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText:
Discussed offline with @moderakh
Final logic is, we will just get rid of partitionKeyRangeId.isEmpty() check.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: please add a unit test for the change. See PartitionKeyInternalTest for existing tests.
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.message: Code review comments. Added unit test for NONE Partition key serialization
Removed createDatabaseIfNotExists with databaseProperties argument. Added more docs
Reverted the StringUtils.EMPTY change, removed empty check for IllegalStateException
